reviewText:
I mean, honestly. What do you want me to say?

It's twenty levels of dodging buzzsaws and rockets fired by a fat corpse on a flying rug that looks like the zombie plague hit while he was queuing up to sign some sort of state molestation register... but it's 76p.

The only two movement keys (up and down) that the game gives you are about as responsive to stimuli as the AD 79 Vesuvius Hiking Club... but it's 76p.

The game can't even reliably keep track of how much food you've collected which, as its main victory condition for each stage, is just utterly diabolical... but it's 76p.

I guess what I'm trying to say is that there's a reason that some games retail for £39.99 and some games go for 76p and really, the best that ZombieRush can hope to aspire to is to provide a pretty thorough explanation to any new gamers on Steam as to exactly why that is.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1vesuQ6XgCc

reviewText: Kontrollit on kaameat, viivettä, ja suunnanvaihto ei onnistu tarkasti. Jos kontrollit ois paremmat, niin tätähän pelais kentät läpi, mutta nyt saa jäädä kymmenen kentän peliksi. Ei vaan jaksa näillä kontrolliasetuksilla.

reviewText: arcade game where all you have are two control keys but you need to play well on it:\nyou\'ll be successfull if you make the flying corpse trying to shoot you from the back shoot flying rigs in front of you;\nthough the game looks to be very simple you should watch carefully and try hard; game\'s very bright, colourful and extremely addictive.
